name: Millennial Pearl Seahorse
desc:
Millennial Pearl Seahorse

One of the two sovereigns standing at the apex of the Fontemer Aberrants. Poets and authors view it as a proud and noble creature, thus bestowing it with its high-flown title.

desc.text:
<color=#ffd780>Elemental Skill</color>
Deals 3 <color=#ffacff>Electro DMG</color> .
If this character has <color=#ffffff>Fontemer Pearl</color> attached, that <color=#ffffff>Usage(s)</color> +1. (Once per Round)
<color=#ece5d8>Fontemer Pearl</color>
<color=#ffd780>Status</color>
<color=#ffffff>When the character to which this is attached takes DMG:</color> Negate 1 DMG. Once per Round, <color=#ffffff>Usage(s)</color> will not be used when negating DMG from Summons.
<color=#ffffff>Usage(s): 2</color>
<color=#ffffff>When you declare the end of your Round:</color> If the character to which this is attached is the active character, draw 1 card.

Elemental Burst
Deals 1 <color=#ffacff>Electro DMG</color> , attaches <color=#ffffff>Fontemer Pearl</color> to this character, and summons 1 <color=#ffffff>Resonant Coral Orb</color> .
<color=#ece5d8>Fontemer Pearl</color>
<color=#ffd780>Status</color>
<color=#ffffff>When the character to which this is attached takes DMG:</color> Negate 1 DMG. Once per Round, <color=#ffffff>Usage(s)</color> will not be used when negating DMG from Summons.
<color=#ffffff>Usage(s): 2</color>
<color=#ffffff>When you declare the end of your Round:</color> If the character to which this is attached is the active character, draw 1 card.

<color=#ffd780>Passive Skill</color>
(Passive) When the battle begins, attach <color=#ffffff>Fontemer Pearl</color> to this character.
<color=#ece5d8>Fontemer Pearl</color>
<color=#ffd780>Status</color>
<color=#ffffff>When the character to which this is attached takes DMG:</color> Negate 1 DMG. Once per Round, <color=#ffffff>Usage(s)</color> will not be used when negating DMG from Summons.
<color=#ffffff>Usage(s): 2</color>
<color=#ffffff>When you declare the end of your Round:</color> If the character to which this is attached is the active character, draw 1 card.

Applies Electro and can trigger the following Elemental Reactions:
[ <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> + <color=#ff9999>Pyro</color> ] <color=#ffffff>Overloaded</color> : DMG +2 for this instance, the target is forcibly switched to the next character
[ <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> + <color=#99ffff>Cryo</color> ] <color=#ffffff>Superconduct</color> : DMG +1 for this instance, deal 1 Piercing DMG to all opposing characters except the target
[ <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> + <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> ] <color=#ffffff>Electro-Charged</color> : DMG +1 for this instance, deal 1 Piercing DMG to all opposing characters except the target
[ <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> + <color=#99ff88>Dendro</color> ] <color=#ffffff>Quicken</color> : DMG +1 for this instance, creates a [ <color=#ffffff>Catalyzing Field</color> ] that grants +1 DMG to the next 2 instances of Dendro or Electro DMG

<color=#ece5d8>Physical DMG</color>
Physical DMG will not apply any Elements, nor can it engage in Elemental Reactions.
<color=#ece5d8>Usage(s)</color>
After this card's effect is triggered, 1 <color=#ffffff>Usage</color> of it will be consumed.
This card will be discarded immediately once it has 0 <color=#ffffff>Usages</color> remaining.

value.name: Pearl Solidification
value.desc:
Millennial Pearl Seahorse: Pearl Solidification

Xenomare Pearl, Fontemer Hoarthunder... The seahorse-shaped phantasmal beast, though a solitary king, has neither an opulent court nor the ruins of one. What it does have, however, is the majesty and might to send other Fontemer Aberrants skittering away from it in terror...

value.text: Reward for accepting the Tavern Challenge at The Cat's Tail and claiming victory in a Friendly Fracas with Millennial Pearl Seahorse

value.name: Millennial Pearl Seahorse
value.desc:
One of the two sovereigns standing at the apex of the Fontemer Aberrants.

Poets and authors often proclaim it to be proud and noble due to its solitary tendencies, but the true reason behind such adulatory descriptions is its elegant and slender body. As such, it is a "Pearl Seahorse," while the suzerain of the Armored Crabs is an "Emperor."

In the legends and rumors of Fontaine, a brutal war was once waged among the Aberrants of the Fontemer, leaving only the "Millennial Pearl Seahorse" and "Emperor of Fire and Iron" splitting the great lake into two courts, one ruling over the north, the other the south. In the "Song of Dobharcu," the writer describes the outcome of the war: the great Hunter's Ray known as the Stormlord stirred huge waves in its death throes, causing what is now known by the people as the "first diluvian period"...

Of course, all of this is nothing more than the romantic imaginations of people who are unwilling to accept the bland realities of the world. For the Fontemer Aberrants are in fact just simple aquatic animals, and they have no grand courts nor fallen kingdoms, nor do they possess words meant to exalt or curse.

customize.name: Millennial Pearl Seahorse
customize.desc:
Millennial Pearl Seahorse

One of the two sovereigns standing at the apex of the Fontemer Aberrants. Poets and authors view it as a proud and noble creature, thus bestowing it with its high-flown title.

customize.name: Lucky Coin
customize.desc: Currency verified and used by the Genius Invokation TCG Society. Can be used to purchase various items related to Genius Invokation TCG. It is said that these coins were initially named as such in the hopes that they would bring those carrying them luck. However, perhaps it is those who are sufficiently lucky who are able to possess them...

customize.text: Can also be exchanged using a

customize.name: Blank Dynamic Card
customize.desc: A blank card with a painted back. It is said that if you put the name of your desired dynamic card on this blank card, you can get the very skin from the Association agent located at the tavern.

customize.text: Tavern Challenge: Friendly Fracas - Millennial Pearl Seahorse's Plie

<color=#ffd780>Stage Introduction</color>
"Meow~" "It's not every cat that gets to witness the underwater world, but Fontainian cats who hire divers as servants have such fortune... Some can even glimpse the exquisitely elegant... seahorse dancers?"
<color=#ccbfad>Special Rule: "Millennial Pearl Seahorse" gains immunity to Frozen, Stun, Petrification and deals +1 DMG when "Fontemer Pearl" is attached. When "Fontemer Pearl" reduces DMG from summons, usages are not consumed.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Opposing Lineup</color>

customize.text: Tavern Challenge: Serious Showdown - Millennial Pearl Seahorse's Pirouette

<color=#ffd780>Stage Introduction</color>
"Meow~" "I've heard that some cats can be so enamored with the beauty of the seahorse dancers, that they too wish to study the art of underwater dance. Alas, swimming is a potentially perilous pastime, and normal cats can but be the audience for such stories, and at most, try it out in the bathtub or a fountain..."
<color=#ccbfad>Special Rule: "Millennial Pearl Seahorse" gains immunity to Frozen, Stun, Petrification and deals +1 DMG when "Fontemer Pearl" is attached. When "Fontemer Pearl" reduces DMG from summons, usages are not consumed.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Opposing Lineup</color>
